intro: Aphanamixis chittagonga, commonly known as the Chittagong aphanamixis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It has a woody stem with dark green, lance-shaped leaves. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
